channel.title: 07 botting
channel.description:
I was wondering if there's any good 07 bots, I know rsbot is currently getting a lot of accounts ban so I was wondering if there were any other ones. I know a lot of 07 streamers botted the hell outta the game to get there 99's so I was just wondering if you guy new of any?
Thanks

item.title: 07 botting
item.dc:creator: @Death_Style Death Style
item.description:
@Death_Style wrote:

cool what’s your rsn so I can add you

Read full topic

item.title: 07 botting
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“kickingjamie, post:16, topic:546232”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=665128.msg4446461#msg4446461 date=1409075534]

Huh??? You botted prayer? Out of all the skills you could bot you chose prayer? Since gilded alters it’s one of the quickest/easiest skills to train.

cbf to run to a random kids house and back to the bank 30 times.

[/quote]
So you just bury bones normally then?[/quote]
No, I used a bot that ran to a kids house and did it for me.

Read full topic

item.title: 07 botting
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Death Style, post:14, topic:546232”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=665128.msg4446377#msg4446377 date=1409017036]

lol yah I remember that sharks went up so much too and like you said they also drop the price in the resource collecting skills because they just mass sell them. The real reason I hate them is because while everyone else is grinding to get there skills up and cash stack higher there doing nothing.

When I botted, it wasn’t to gain money or anything. It was to do the annoying/boring skills.
Like prayer, or fletching, or etc. The skills I paid for, but just cbf’d to do because it’d take 4 days of grinding.

I haven’t botted in some time, around when EOC came out and Botwatch was put in was my stop.

In the time I only got caught botting once on my current account. A friend of mine also got caught botting on my acc too, but yeah.
I used to bot dungeoneering 24/7. I had an account that started at 50 dung and when I lost the account (hacked ) it was at 102.
[/quote]
gg botter[/quote]
Eh. Shit happens.

Read full topic

When I botted, it wasn’t to gain money or anything. It was to do the annoying/boring skills.
Like prayer, or fletching, or etc. The skills I paid for, but just cbf’d to do because it’d take 4 days of grinding.

item.title: 07 botting
item.dc:creator: @Dan0194 Dan0194
item.description:
@Dan0194 wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:8, topic:546232”]I’ve only met one person that’s been banned for botting though they weren’t. And that was Arham. (Still waiting on confirmation, I find it bs.)
However, RuneScape has an amazing system on how they ban botters.
They have admitted that they do not ban a botter instantly, that would be too easy and to boring.
Instead, once you’ve been flagged as a botter, the system will ban you at random.
It could be 3 months after, and you randomly get hit.

I can’t find the article where they said it randomly busts you, but am looking (kinda)

Just enjoy the game and get your skills back I hate people that bot it’s not fair.

I agree and disagree with you.

While botters are an issue in game, not all of them are. I remember back when they did one of the first Bot Nukes… In about a months time all resource prices went up by around 100% or more. Raw Swordfish you bought at 500gp were now 2k, and cooked were still the low price of 500-600gp. Thus making it a loss to cook anything (but the fishing markets were great).

Botters make skilling cheaper, since they collect most of the resources for you and dump them into the market.
Most people will skill enough for themselves, or sell to the market only for profit. Bots typically just sell and sell.

Now, on the opposite side of the argument. Botters also make it harder to get profit from resource collecting skills. They drop the price of resources (see, both good and bad) making it so when you sell them, you get less money per.[/quote]

lol yah I remember that sharks went up so much too and like you said they also drop the price in the resource collecting skills because they just mass sell them. The real reason I hate them is because while everyone else is grinding to get there skills up and cash stack higher there doing nothing.

Read full topic

item.title: 07 botting
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

I’ve only met one person that’s been banned for botting though they weren’t. And that was Arham. (Still waiting on confirmation, I find it bs.)
However, RuneScape has an amazing system on how they ban botters.
They have admitted that they do not ban a botter instantly, that would be too easy and to boring.
Instead, once you’ve been flagged as a botter, the system will ban you at random.
It could be 3 months after, and you randomly get hit.

I can’t find the article where they said it randomly busts you, but am looking (kinda)

Dan0194:

Just enjoy the game and get your skills back I hate people that bot it’s not fair.

I agree and disagree with you.

While botters are an issue in game, not all of them are. I remember back when they did one of the first Bot Nukes… In about a months time all resource prices went up by around 100% or more. Raw Swordfish you bought at 500gp were now 2k, and cooked were still the low price of 500-600gp. Thus making it a loss to cook anything (but the fishing markets were great).

Botters make skilling cheaper, since they collect most of the resources for you and dump them into the market.
Most people will skill enough for themselves, or sell to the market only for profit. Bots typically just sell and sell.

Now, on the opposite side of the argument. Botters also make it harder to get profit from resource collecting skills. They drop the price of resources (see, both good and bad) making it so when you sell them, you get less money per.

Read full topic
